definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: Of course, being a locavore is easier said than done.
sentences.chinese: 當然，“喫本地的新鮮食物”總是說起來比做着容易。

sentences.english: Perhaps it's better to be a well-paid nanny than an attention-starved rich kid.
sentences.chinese: 也許做一個高薪保姆比做缺乏關心的有錢小孩要好。

sentences.english: Life is often likened to sea voyage.
sentences.chinese: 人生常被比做海上航行。

sentences.english: He likened the story to Tolstoy's moral tales.
sentences.chinese: 他把這個故事比做托爾斯泰的道德名篇。

sentences.english: He compared Beijing to the heart of China.
sentences.chinese: 他把北京比做中國的心臟。

sentences.english: Getting it done well on time is much more important than doing it “Perfectly”.
sentences.chinese: 按時把工作做好比做得“完美”重要得多。

sentences.english: Not obviously easier said than done.
They've fixed on Ashby as the new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他們決定讓阿什比做新的主席。

sentences.english: A. She compared the restless boy with a noisy monkey.
sentences.chinese: 她把那個好動的男孩比做一隻吵鬧的猴子。

sentences.english: One double bass player likened the experience to being conducted by a metronome.
sentences.chinese: 一個大貝斯手將這段經歷比做被一個節拍器指揮。

sentences.english: However, they often talk more than they do.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他們常常說的比做的多。

definition: to be just like/can be compared to
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
not equal to/not as good as/inferior to/it would be better to
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
